body: $ZIM what happened here??
$ZIM Looks ultra-bullish to me.

$ZIM Higher freight rates have brought container shipping company Hapag-Lloyd an increase in profits in the first half of the year and made the executive board even more confident for 2022. The second half of the year is also expected to exceed previous expectations
created_at: Hapag-Lloyd announced on Thursday. As a result
column3: the management now expects operating earnings (Ebit) of between 16.3 and 18.2 billion euros for 2022. However
column4: the executive board qualified that the forecast was &quot;subject to high uncertainties&quot; due to the war in Ukraine
column5: disrupted supply chains and the effects of the Covid 19 pandemic. In the first half of the year
column6: EBIT shot up to 9.1 (previous year: 2.9) billion euros. In April
column7: Germany's largest shipping company had already significantly raised its EBIT forecast to 11.7 to 13.6 billion euros
